description: Equivalent to persecute +‎ -ion. From Middle English persecucioun, from Old French persecucion , from Ecclesiastical Latin persecūtio (“persecution; chase, pursuit”), from Latin persequor (“follow up, pursue”), from per- (“through”) +‎ sequor (“follow”). Displaced native Old English ēhtnes.

entries.meaning: A program or campaign to subjugate or eliminate a specific group of people, often based on race, religion, sexuality, or social beliefs.
